rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An atomic unit of a workflow that involves some input entity needed to complete the step, and produces some outcomes, such as a document.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: step

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A concept that is related somehow to a term (e.g. because it represents the meaning of a particular term).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has related concept

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: It links a document version with another altered or updated version of it.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has revision

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An international agreement concluded between States, and bilateral or multilateral agreements governed by international law to which international organizations are parties.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: treaty

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An actor (e.g. a person, an organisation) that can perform some actions.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: agent

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document summarising discussions held during a conference. It may also contain full text of resolutions or decisions, either proposed or adopted; recommended actions to be taken by other organs, etc., in the body of the document or as annexes.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: conference report
communication
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document containing an official communication used to formally inform the UN community of events and of the outcome of non-UN meetings, to transmit reports or communications, and for a variety of other purposes. Its structures vary widely across organizations and traditions but generally assume the format of a formal communication with title and content in unnumbered paragraphs.
A particular language adopted by the United Nation for publishing their documents (e.g. Arabic, Chinese, English, French, Russian, Spanish).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: language

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document containing specialized information of specific interests.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: circular
document
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document of a specific kind (e.g. normative documents, legal documents, etc.) published by someone for certain reasons.

A document containing formal proposals for modifications, as single instruction or as a collection of instructions, of previously issued documents issued by the same body that approved the original document. Its structures vary widely across organizations and traditions.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: modificatory instruction

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The situation that involves an entity (with the object property tvc:hasValue) having a particular value (tvc:withValue) associated during a certain time interval (tvc:atTime) and within a specific context (tvc:withinContext).
rdf:Description.dc:description:
This class is based on a particular ontology pattern called Time-indexed Value in Context (http://www.essepuntato.it/2012/04/tvc). It has been used by several ontologies for describing values that can be assigned/held by an entity at different times and according to different contexts. Notable ontologies that are using it are the Publishing Roles Ontology (PRO, http://purl.org/spar/pro) and the Publishing Status Ontology (PSO, http://purl.org/spar/pso).
More information are available at the following paper:
Peroni, S., Shotton, D., Vitali, F. (2012). Scholarly publishing and the Linked Data: describing roles, statuses, temporal and contextual extents. In Sack, H., Pellegrini, T. (Eds.), Proceedings of the 8th International Conference on Semantic Systems (i-Semantics 2012): 9-16. New York, New York, USA: ACM. DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.1145/2362499.2362502 (Open Access version available at http://speroni.web.cs.unibo.it/publications/peroni-2012-scholarly-publishing-linked.pdf)
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: value in time and context
code of practice
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document that defines correct procedures on how to implement principles and/or standards.

The United Nations Document Ontology (UNDO) is an OWL 2 DL ontology that aims at providing a framework for the description of all entities and the relations that are explicitly or implicitly introduced within United Nations documents (normative documents, legal documents, etc.).
rdf:Description.dc:rights: This work is distributed under a Creative Commons Attribution License (http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: UNDO
rdf:Description.dc:title: The United Nations System Document Ontology (UNDO)
rdf:Description.dc:creator: Silvio Peroni (http://orcid.org/0000-0003-0530-4305)

rdf:Description.dc:description: This entity representing the English language has been originally defined in the Library of Congress concept scheme (skos:ConceptScheme) available at http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/iso639-1, which maps all the two-letters codes for languages introduced in the specification ISO 639-1 as Linked Open Data.
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The English is one of the languages used for publishing United Nations documents.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: English

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Formal provision concerning commands, recommendations, opinions or expressions of will issued or entered into by a principal or a subsidiary organ or other empowered bodies. Usually, it is articulated in hierarchical structures, in which the text is subdivided into higher and lower subdivisions.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: normative document
court decision
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document introducing a court of law or adjudicating authority formal decision or specific determination following a legal proceedings. The typical narrative of judgments is often divided in background, introduction, motivation and decision.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: document version
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A particular version of a document written according to a certain language.

rdf:Description.dc:description: This entity representing the French language has been originally defined in the Library of Congress concept scheme (skos:ConceptScheme) available at http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/iso639-1, which maps all the two-letters codes for languages introduced in the specification ISO 639-1 as Linked Open Data.
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The French is one of the languages used for publishing United Nations documents.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: French
administrative circular
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document containing general information of administrative nature as well as clarifications of established rules, policies and procedures.
A document introducing an opinion rendered by a court or adjudicating body upon request.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: advisory opinion
paper
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An official document that provides information about a particular subject or a detailed account of issues, policies or outcomes of, for example, inquiries or scientific investigations. Its structures vary widely across organizations and traditions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: official compilation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An authoritative compilation of official documents.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has reconfiguration
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: This property describes documents that are intended to be reconfigured somehow in another original document in a sufficient degree to warrant their being considered as new works, rather than simply different versions of the same document.
This property enables one to specify the language associated to a particular document version.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has language
administrative instruction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document that prescribes instructions and procedures for the implementation of rules and regulations, as well as formally communicate decisions on, for example, appointment, promotion, transfer and change of duty station.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: workflow
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A description of a sequence of connected steps, representing a sequence of publishing operations undertaken by agents.
A value identifying the status of a document (e.g. in drafting, under revision, published).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: status

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Official written correspondence; communications or notes verbale concerning issues under the authority of the organisation to provide information, requiring specific action by the addressees or stating a position.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: official letter
administrative issuance
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Document concerning administrative instructions and circulars. Their structures vary widely across organizations and traditions but may have the format of a formal communication with a title and content in unnumbered or numbered paragraphs or be divided into sections.

rdf:Description.dc:description: This entity representing the Arabic language has been originally defined in the Library of Congress concept scheme (skos:ConceptScheme) available at http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/iso639-1, which maps all the two-letters codes for languages introduced in the specification ISO 639-1 as Linked Open Data.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Arabic
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Arabic is one of the languages used for publishing United Nations documents.
An essay detailing facts and opinions regarding specific issues.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: position paper

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An official written communication issued to disseminate information.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: memoranda

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document containing information not requiring any action by the addressees.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: bulletin
note
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A written communication to transmit comments or reports.

Formal expressions of the opinion or will of a principal or subsidiary organ or other empowered bodies. Usually they are open structure documents, sometimes articulated in hierarchical structures in which the text is subdivided into higher and lower subdivisions, generally including a preamble and operative paragraphs.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: deliberative document
value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Something that can be held by an entity (e.g. a particular role or status).
A collection of individual autonomous documents.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: collection

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Documents containing full first-person records of a meeting (verbatim). Their structure reflects the different section of the debates and/or alternation of questions and answers that take place during meetings discussions.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: meeting record
has proponent
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The proponent entity of a relation.
A document providing a third-person accounts of meetings.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: meeting minute
action
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An event with at least one agent that is participant in it and that is linked to a workflow execution and to a step of a workflow description.
A set guides to enforce a statutory instrument or regulate activities.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: regulation

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document formalising a decision or specific determination following a legal proceeding. Its structures are highly formalised.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: judgement

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document that provides modifications to other normative documents. The modifications could appear in different structured texts like normative and deliberative documents, debate records, etc.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: amendment

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Russian is one of the languages used for publishing United Nations documents.
rdf:Description.dc:description: This entity representing the Russian language has been originally defined in the Library of Congress concept scheme (skos:ConceptScheme) available at http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/iso639-1, which maps all the two-letters codes for languages introduced in the specification ISO 639-1 as Linked Open Data.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Russian

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document that prescribes guides for conduct or actions, such as rules for conducting business within a body, as well as for the financial administration of organizations and their members.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rules of procedure

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document listing rules outlining the responsibilities of, or proper practices for, individuals, parties, organizations, or countries on specific issues.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: code of conduct

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document describing a set of fundamental principles or established precedents according to which a body is acknowledged to be governed.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: constitution
convention
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Mandatory regulations subject to ratification. Instruments usually negotiated under the auspices of an international organization.
The Spanish is one of the languages used for publishing United Nations documents.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Spanish
rdf:Description.dc:description: This entity representing the Spanish language has been originally defined in the Library of Congress concept scheme (skos:ConceptScheme) available at http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/iso639-1, which maps all the two-letters codes for languages introduced in the specification ISO 639-1 as Linked Open Data.

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The documentary output of the process meant to share information in any form or medium.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: publication

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document exemplifying keynote speeches and opening addresses and messages.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: address

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A written communication to the public that serves information purposes only. It is not considered an official document.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: press release

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document listing proposals for modifications submitted to official deliberative bodies for discussion. It provides modifications to other normative documents.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: amendment list
annotated agenda
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An agenda with a brief description of agenda items, citation of related documents as well as information and other announcements.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: annotation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A mechanism that allows someone to link a specific entity (e.g. a relation) to a target document (or its parts), with the intent of specifying from where that entity has been actually derived from.
A document introducing a pronunciation of officers in their official capacity.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: official statement
workflow execution
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A collection of actions that address all the step defined in a workflow.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: policy
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document introducing general course or principle of action adopted or proposed by the official authorities or bodies.
A document that provides guidance and may create reporting obligations for parties.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: recommendation
meeting report
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Documents containing summarized accounts of meetings. Their structures vary widely across organizations and traditions.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has receiver
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The receiver entity of a relation.

A document summarising discussions held during a council. It may also contain full text of resolutions or decisions, either proposed or adopted; recommended actions to be taken by other organs, etc., in the body of the document or as annexes.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: council report
decision
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document describing a formal action regarding administrative and procedural matters of principal or subsidiary organ or other empowered bodies. This kind of documents is sometimes also used to record the adoption of a text representing the consensus of the members of a given organ.
International agreement that supplements a previous treaty or international agreement.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: protocol

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document introducing a set of guides established by consensus outlining the responsibilities of, or proper practices for, individuals, parties, organizations or countries on specific issues.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: standard

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The semantics of a relation.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has semantics

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Something that allows one to link a proponent entity to a receiver entity according to a specific semantics - e.g. saying that a document (proponent) cites (semantics) another document (receiver), or that an organization (proponent) approves (semantics) a certain document (receiver), etc.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: relation

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document listing agenda items to be considered at a specific meeting/s or session/s. It may report time, location, etc.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: agenda listing

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document prescribing principles governing conduct or procedure within a particular area of activity.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: rules

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A particular time period characterised by a starting date (specified by means of the property ti:hasIntervalStartDate) and an ending date (specified by means of the property ti:hasIntervalEndDate).
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: interval

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Foundational treaty outlining the conditions under which a body is organised, and defining its rights and privileges.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: charter

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Chinese is one of the languages used for publishing United Nations documents.
rdf:Description.dc:description: This entity representing the Chinise language has been originally defined in the Library of Congress concept scheme (skos:ConceptScheme) available at http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/iso639-1, which maps all the two-letters codes for languages introduced in the specification ISO 639-1 as Linked Open Data.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Chinese

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A particular kind of document that contains a formal expression of the will of a principal or subsidiary organ or other empowered bodies.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: resolution
meeting agenda
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Documents listing agenda items of a meeting or a series of meetings, at times with brief description of agenda items, citation of related documents, and other announcements, such as consultations, informal meetings or side events, as well as summaries of the previous day's meetings. Their structures vary widely across organizations and traditions.
The class of all the types for categorising the steps in workflow descriptions.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: step type

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document assessing projects or processes.
rdf:Description.rdfs:label: progress report
